comments.author: firefox@spunx.de
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b9) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b9
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b9) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b9

The manual Proxy Configuration does not work. Connecting to internet and intranet fails instantly with Page Not Found error. 
BUT:  I use a Proxy through a SSH tunnel. So my proxy is set to "localhost:8080". If I use the corporate proxy (e.g. wwwproxy.domain.com:80) it works!

Restarting Firefox does not fix the problem. With FF 4 Beta 8 all works fine, the problem occurs with update to beta 9. Clean install of Beta 9 also exhibits the same problems. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. set a proxy (localhost:8080)

Actual Results:  
Page Not Found error

comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.raw_text:
Do you use your SSH tunnel as Http proxy or as socks proxy ?
Using as socks proxy works for me with Seamonkey trunk on win32
comments.text:
Do you use your SSH tunnel as Http proxy or as socks proxy ?
Using as socks proxy works for me with Seamonkey trunk on win32

comments.raw_text:
I using my SSH tunnel as a socks proxy.

According to the release notes to the FF Add-on Foxyproxy 2.22.5 (http://getfoxyproxy.org/releasenotes.html) I assume that this Bug is related to another bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=622321
comments.text:

comments.author: firefox@spunx.de

comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.text: socks is using the local DNS server except if you set network.proxy.socks_remote_dns to true. Is your local DNS server working / can windows resolve hostnames  ?
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.raw_text: socks is using the local DNS server except if you set network.proxy.socks_remote_dns to true. Is your local DNS server working / can windows resolve hostnames  ?

comments.creator: firefox@spunx.de
comments.text: Yes it can. This is not the problem. I use another firefox without proxy on this system and it worked with FF 4b8.
